diagrams.description: A timeline showing the history of Natural Language Processing (NLP).
diagrams.mermaid_code:
timeline
    title: The History of Natural Language Processing (NLP)
    section: The 1950s - The Beginnings
        1950: Alan Turing's Turing Test
        1954: The Georgetown-IBM experiment, the first machine translation system
    section: The 1960s-1980s - The Symbolic Era
        1960s: ELIZA, a chatbot that mimicked a psychotherapist
        1970s: SHRDLU, a natural language understanding program
        1980s: The rise of rule-based and symbolic approaches
    section: The 1990s - The Statistical Revolution
        1990s: The rise of statistical methods and machine learning
        1990s: The development of probabilistic models for NLP
    section: The 2000s - The Rise of Big Data
        2001: The first neural language model
        2000s: The development of large-scale annotated corpora
    section: The 2010s - The Deep Learning Revolution
        2013: Word2Vec
        2014: The encoder-decoder model
        2017: The Transformer architecture
    section: The 2020s - The Age of Large Language Models
        2020: GPT-3 is released
        2022: ChatGPT is released
